content:
I've been using notion for a long time. It is an amazing markdown note taking app. I manage all the issues, PR's, commits to zulip in notion. I came across its feature on link embedding.
When we paste a link to an issue, pr, commit etc.
image.png
It asks for this options.

  • For "Paste as preview"
    image.png

  • For "Paste as mention"
    image.png

What are your views about this, can make such type of link embeds options in Zulip?

I don't think it makes sense to ask on every link paste, you copy paste links into chat and don't care about if it gets embeded or not.

But do we have a syntax to escape embeding? I think that's important.

Twitter Bot said:
https://twitter.com/guan/status/1335075700743802880

Thank you, Zulip, for showing me this face every time I paste something from the Linux repository. https://twitter.com/guan/status/1335075700743802880/photo/1

- guan üê∞üêïüá™üá∫ (@guan)

Tangential, but it looks like now the embeds show the repo name, not the user's profile picture. e.g.
Screen-Shot-2022-02-03-at-10.27.24-AM.png

I think the biggest blocker to this is how it's represented in the markdown. Since we don't have a WYSIWYG editor, we would either need to effectively paste in the formatting for whichever format you chose (either making client-side requests to github, or proxying via a new endpoint on the server), or some magic expansion which happened to whatever markdown you submitted, at render time.

Yash RE said:

But do we have a syntax to escape embeding? I think that's important.

Nope, we have an open issue: #19466

I would definitely appreciate seeing the titles of issues and PRs.

On GitHub itself I frequently hover on an issue or PR link to see what it's about. In a Zulip thread, I have to either go and open an entire tab for it‚Ä¶ or just guess, or stay unsure what the context of the conversation is about (when it's a conversation I don't absolutely have to follow.) Which often means the latter, because that's a lot of overhead.

Greg Price said:

Which often means the latter, because that's a lot of overhead.

Yep, this is #19710. See also CZO thread. Looks like there was an older thread as well.
I linked to some relevant prior discussions in #design > Link embed in the message. . Should we continue the conversation over there?
I think you meant to post that elsewhere, as this is #design > Link embed in the message. :smile:
(this thread reminded me to start the conversation for github specifically as #feedback > more information on github PR links)

Ooops, heh, indeed, I was trying to post on #feedback > more information on github PR links . Anyway, continuing either place is fine, as long as folks are aware of the prior issue and discussions. :)
I'm not entirely sure whether the right strategy for this topic is a tighter GitHub integration (which would be about hover behavior showing the PR/issue details) or something else.
I suppose it's worth considering the design direction for link embeds of having some sort of on-hover option for links, as different from either "no preview" or "moderately tall preview".
For github, one not-too-hard option is just to have a better preview coded in, like we do with, e.g. Dropbox links.
Yeah, exactly, that's what I had in mind is the "tighter GitHub integration" idea referenced above.
